summary: React 185 infinite loop error STILL OCCURRING despite useShallow fix. Error happens during tab navigation and causes app crashes.

critical_bugs.issue: React 185 'Maximum update depth exceeded' error still occurring during tab navigation
critical_bugs.error_message: Maximum update depth exceeded. This can happen when a component repeatedly calls setState inside componentWillUpdate or componentDidUpdate. React limits the number of nested updates to prevent infinite loops.
critical_bugs.impact: App crashes and shows error boundary when navigating between tabs

critical_bugs.issue: getSnapshot result not cached causing infinite loop warning
critical_bugs.error_message: Warning: The result of getSnapshot should be cached to avoid an infinite loop

navigation_issues.issue: Clicking History tab triggers React 185 error and app crash

working_features.status: Works intermittently - sometimes loads without error
Works correctly - clicking player names navigates to profile
Works correctly - returns from player profile to dashboard
Shows correctly - yellow warning about being temporarily disabled

passed_tests: Player profile navigation via clicking player names
Browser back button from player profile
action_item_for_main_agent: CRITICAL: React 185 infinite loop error is NOT fixed. The useShallow fix applied to roster components is incomplete. The error still occurs in ClientDashboardInner and CommandRail components during tab navigation. Need to apply useShallow fix to ALL components that subscribe to dashboard store, not just roster components. Also need to fix getSnapshot caching in CommandRail component.

success_percentage.frontend: 30% - Basic navigation works but critical infinite loop error still occurs
